properties.name: Caldera
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 224 NW 13th Ave. Portland Or 97209503 937 7563 One to five week residencies during fall, winter and spring. Ninety acres located on the shore of a cerulean blue lake formed in the cinder cone of an extinct volcano in central Oregon. Private A-frame cottages. No fees; residents responsible for travel, food and materials.

properties.name: Djerassi Resident Artists Program
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 2325 Bear Gulch Rd. Woodside CA 94062650-747-1250 Sixty residencies of four to five weeks between late march and mid-november. Located in the Santa Cruz Mountains overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Visual, Literary, Performance, Film, Sound.

properties.name: Fishtrap Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 400 East Grant St., P.O. Box 38 Enterprise, Or 97828541-426-3623 One residency program brings published author to Wallowa County classrooms and communities for the third nine week term each school year. (Literary)

properties.name: Headlands Center for the Arts
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 944 Fort Barry, Sausalito CA 94965415-331-2787 Thirty residencies per year, four weeks to eleven months from February through November. Located in the Marin Headlands just north of the Golden Gate Bridge in the Golden Gate National Recreation Area. Only for artists from California, Ohio and North Carolina. Artists participate in a public open house. (Visual, Media, Literary and Performance.

properties.name: Herbert Hoover National Historic Site
properties.description: Posted by Paiges P.O. Box 607, West Branch, IA 52358Two and three week residencies. (Visual, Perfromance, and Film)

properties.name: Joshua Tree National Park Artist Residency Program
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  74485 National Park Drive, Twenty-Nine Palms, CA 92277760-367-5539 Four to six residencies of four weeks per year, October through May. Located on 800,000 acres in the Mojave and Colorado deserts among granite cliffs, spires and ancient archeological sites. Primitive, rustic cabins wiht no electricity. Personal transportation required and artists should be prepared for extreme temperature ranges and high winds. ( Visual, Literary, and Media Arts)

properties.name: Klondike Goldrush National Historical Park Artist Residency Program
properties.description: Posted by Paiges P.O. Box 317 Skagway AK 99840907-983-9221 One or two residencies of six to eight weeks per year, October through April. (Visual, Performing, Literary, Film, and Music)

properties.name: Mesa Refuge
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 1221 preservation Park Way, Suite 101, Oakland CA 94612510-834-2995 Residencies of two to six weeks near the seashoreof Point Reyes atop the San Andreas Fault. Particularly interested in supporting writers working on themes od social justice, the economy and the environment. Includes room and most meals for experienced and new writers. ( Literary)

properties.name: Oregon College of Art and Craft
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 8245 SW Barnes Rd. Portland Or 97225503-297-5544 Four month residency for emerging artists during academic year and summer residencies for mid-career artists. Located on eight-acre wooded hillside. Stipend provided; artists provide food; extensive equipment on site. (Bokk Arts, Ceramic, Drawing, Metalsmithing, Jewelry, Photography, Furniture Making)

properties.name: Sitka Center for Art and Ecology
properties.description: Posted by Paiges P.O. Box 65 Otis, Or 97368541-994-5485 Two residency positions averaging three to four months, running from October to January and February to May. Located in the Cascade head National Science Research Area overlooking the Salmon River Estuary and Pacific Ocean. No fees; artists purchase and prepare own meals; artists asked to contribute 20 hours per month to community service and maintenance. Etching Press, Skutt Kiln, Slide projection, mechanical potters wheel available. ( Visual, Literary, Performing, Architecture and Design)

properties.name: Soapstone
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 622 SE 29th Ave. Portland Or. 97214503-233-3936 Two women writers at a time for one to four weeks. Located on 22 acres on the Soapstone Creek. Writers provide own food and linens. Residency wired for electricity, but heat is from wood stoves.

properties.name: The Artistery
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  4315 SE Division St Portland, OR 97206The Artistery is an intentional art community that encourages all creative forms. We provide a supportive and intimate environment for those who desire to be creative. We have programs in place for adult and child art education, affordable art facilities, gallery space, and a music venue that caters to all ages. Through this we hope to bring a sense of community and support to the local arts.

properties.name: Willard R. Espy Literary Foundation
properties.description: Posted by Paiges P.O. Box 614 Oysterville, WA 98641360-665-5220 Four ongoing, one month writers\' residencies. Open to writers living or originally from the Pacific Northwest, or whose work deals with subject matter specific to the Pacific Northwest. Two Bay-view cottages; weekly stipend for food. (Literary)

properties.name: Yosemite National Park Artist Residency Program
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  P.O. Box 100 Yosemite National Park, CA 95389209-372-4024 Four to ten artists per year selected for residencies of up to one month year-round. Located in the Sierra Nevadas of central California. Parkland encompasses granite domes that rise high over broad meadows, giant sequoias, and some the nations highest waterfalls. Artists exhibit in park gallery. (Visual Arts)
